Header: Mars reaches its closest approach to Earth in 15 years
Content: Mars reached its closest approach to Earth with a distance of 57.6 million kilometers. It is the closest the two planets have been to one another since the historic 55.6 million kilometers close approach in August 2003. Team members from NASAâ€™s Jet Propulsion Laboratory gathered at Griffith Observatory in Los Angeles, California, to view the big event. The next similar close approach is not slated to occur for another 17 years. On September 11, 2035, Earth and Mars will be even closer at a distance of 56.9 million kilometers.
